page.title: 07LANDFILL AND PLANTLIFE
page.content: It takes 6mths for the grass to start to grow on the piles of rubbish. There are all kinds of wild plants and flowers there which attract wild life. Where the leachate comes of the sprayer the plants that grow there are seaplants because the leachate is salty like the sea. Sea asters grow along the{VANGE AND EASTHAVEN CREEKS. There is some hemlock growing there and it has some purple blotches on the stalk and they are poisonous.In some places the earth has sunk and thats because the rubbish rots quicker than in the other places. Where it has sunk there is water and it is from the leachate and the rain.Land away from the actual dumping site is used by farmers for grazing their cattle and sheep.
